segments.text: I see a woman drying a plate, completely unaware of the water overflowing from the sink.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot is already in the puddle, but she doesn’t even seem to notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is pouring over the edge like a tiny waterfall, and she’s just standing there.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’s lost in thought or just really focused on that plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids behind her are up to no good, but she doesn’t have a clue.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how oblivious she is to everything happening around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is going to ruin the floor, and she’s just polishing away.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think she might be in for a big surprise when she finally looks down.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene is so absurd, it’s almost funny.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But mostly, I’m just worried about the mess she’s going to have to clean up.
segments.speaker: PAR
